data.title: About

data.text:
The pianist Polina Nagy was born in 1990 in Budapest, Hungary. At school she learned church music, organ and piano. A love of Liszt and Schumann made her decide to dedicate herself to the piano.

In 2013 at the Contemporary Piano Music Festival in Győr she won a Special Award. She played in Bartók Radio in Hungary, at Steinway events and at various festivals and concerts in Hungary and Germany.

She completed a Bachelor’s Degree at the University of Pécs in Hungary with professors Melinda Weisenfeld and József Bánky. After that she got the chance to spend a year getting lessons with Márta Gulyás in Budapest.

She is currently studying with Patrick O’Byrne at the Hochschule für Künste, Bremen.

She has participated in master classes with famous musicians such as Malcolm Bilson, Dmitri Bashkirov, Gábor Eckhardt, Balázs Szokolay, Dalibor Miklavčič, István Várdai, Kristóf Baráti.
